ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed the skills learnt in L1 Spanish and learnt to communicate more fluidly in Spanish.
I learned more vocabulary and conjugations and became conversational in my Spanish.
More thorough understanding of Spanish grammar and more vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It is good at teaching you but very hard at grading.
I had a good professor and the class was great about teaching culture as well as language. I wish we practiced more conversation.
Strengths: practice speaking every day, online homework forces students to have consistent practice with grammar Weaknesses: much of the work is tedious and does not help (FLASH CULTURA)
it could have been better at developing speaking skills, by speaking all in spanish but making sure that the spanish was spoken slowly
I thought that the flash culturas were graded very harshly for a homework assignment. However on the supersite homework, I liked that you were given 3 attempts.

Strengths: many varied assignments that got you practicing Spanish every day. Weaknesses: too focused on exams and grades. Many students are freshmen straight out of high school, so they are still coming in with the "get the grade" mentality, rather than a desire to learn a new language. I think the syllabus is also too much geared towards a bunch of quizzes, tests, and presentations. Also, there should be more freedom given to individual instructors, and it was a bit too Spain-oriented.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class to a student who wanted to learn Spanish and was interested in Spanish culture and history.
If looking to learn Spanish, take the course

Sure. If you have a language requirement and you did Spanish L1 you pretty much have to. If you just want to learn, go ahead because you will learn a lot quickly, but be prepared that people might not be as excited as you are.
